thread.title_full: Did an iPhone7 Plus blow up while charging? Apple investigates teenager‚Äôs claim

author: news.com.au
title: Did an iPhone7 blow up while charging? Apple investigates teenager‚Äôs claim
text:
APPLE is reportedly investigating an American teenager‚Äôs claims her iPhone 7 Plus ‚Äúblew up‚Äù while it was charging. 
The teenager, Brianna Olivas, posted a video on Twitter this week showing her showing her rose-gold iPhone 7 Plus with a melted case smouldering on a bathroom counter.
She said the phone began spewing smoke while it was charging.
‚ÄúSo my iPhone 7 plus blew up this morning... was not even using it, literally no explanation for this,‚Äù she wrote along with the video.
Apple said they were investigating the incident.
So my IPhone 7 plus blew up this morning ü§ó was not even using it, literally no explanation for this pic.twitter.com/sQ8CJt4Y69 
‚Äî Bree‚ú® (@briannaolivas_) February 23, 2017 ‚ÄúWe are in touch with the customer and looking into it,‚Äù an Apple representative told Mashable , which first reported the news.
For now, there‚Äôs no evidence that the charred remains of this particular iPhone 7 are anything but an isolated incident, although in October Australian surf instructor Mat Jones reported a similar incident with the smartphone .
Apple did not respond to a request for further information on Friday, Reuters reported.
Last year, Samsung took a major financial hit after its high-end Galaxy Note 7 smartphone turned out to be at risk for catching fire or even exploding because of a battery design flaw.
The company issued a recall but its replacement units had the same issue.
Samsung was forced to kill off the device , which the company said would result in losses of more than $6.5 billion.
